info.title: Hydrogen REST API
info.description: A comprehensive REST API for the Hydrogen Project that provides system information, OIDC authentication, and various service endpoints

tags.name: Auth Service
tags.description: Provides login, logout, renew and related JWT operations.

tags.name: Conduit Service
tags.description: Provides database query execution by reference with support for multiple database engines.

tags.name: OIDC Service
tags.description: Provides OpenID Connect protocol endpoints and authentication services

tags.name: System Service
tags.description: Provides system-level operations, monitoring, and diagnostics

post.description: Authenticates users via username/email and password, validates API key, performs security checks (IP whitelist/blacklist, rate limiting), and returns a JWT token upon successful authentication.

login_id.description: Username or email address for authentication

post.description: Invalidates a JWT token by removing it from storage
Registers a new user account with comprehensive validation
Renews a valid JWT token with updated expiration timestamp

post.summary: Execute multiple authenticated database queries in parallel with database override
post.description: Executes multiple pre-defined queries from the Query Table Cache in parallel with JWT authentication and database override capability. The database name can be specified in the request body, allowing access to different databases than the one in the JWT claims. Supports typed parameters (INTEGER, STRING, BOOLEAN, FLOAT) for each query. Returns an array of query results in JSON format with execution metadata.

query_ref.description: The query reference ID that was executed

rows.description: Array of result rows as JSON objects

queue_used.description: Database queue that handled the request

database.description: Database name from request (overridden from JWT)

total_execution_time_ms.description: Total time for all queries in milliseconds

post.summary: Execute authenticated database query with database override
post.description: Executes a pre-defined query from the Query Table Cache using a query reference ID with JWT authentication and database override capability. The database name can be specified in the request body, allowing access to different databases than the one in the JWT claims. Supports typed parameters (INTEGER, STRING, BOOLEAN, FLOAT). Returns query results in JSON format with execution metadata.

query_ref.description: The query reference ID that was executed

rows.description: Array of result rows as JSON objects

queue_used.description: Database queue that handled the request

database.description: Database name from request (overridden from JWT)
Target database name (required, overrides JWT claims)

query_ref.description: Query identifier from Query Table Cache (required)

post.summary: Execute multiple authenticated database queries in parallel
post.description: Executes multiple pre-defined queries from the Query Table Cache in parallel with JWT authentication. The database name is extracted from the JWT token claims, ensuring secure routing. Supports typed parameters (INTEGER, STRING, BOOLEAN, FLOAT) for each query. Returns an array of query results in JSON format with execution metadata. Subject to rate limiting based on MaxQueriesPerRequest configuration (default: 10).

query_ref.description: The query reference ID that was executed

rows.description: Array of result rows as JSON objects

queue_used.description: Database queue that handled the request

total_execution_time_ms.description: Total time for all queries in milliseconds

queries.description: Array of queries to execute in parallel (required)

query_ref.description: Query identifier from Query Table Cache (required)

post.summary: Execute authenticated database query by reference
post.description: Executes a pre-defined query from the Query Table Cache using a query reference ID with JWT authentication. The database name is extracted from the JWT token claims, ensuring secure routing. Supports typed parameters (INTEGER, STRING, BOOLEAN, FLOAT). Returns query results in JSON format with execution metadata.

query_ref.description: The query reference ID that was executed

rows.description: Array of result rows as JSON objects

queue_used.description: Database queue that handled the request

query_ref.description: Query identifier from Query Table Cache (required)

post.summary: Execute multiple database queries in parallel
post.description: Executes multiple pre-defined queries from the Query Table Cache in parallel without authentication. Requires explicit database parameter in request. Supports typed parameters (INTEGER, STRING, BOOLEAN, FLOAT) for each query. Returns an array of query results in JSON format with execution metadata. Subject to rate limiting based on MaxQueriesPerRequest configuration (default: 10).

Executes a pre-defined query from the Query Table Cache using a query reference ID. Supports typed parameters (INTEGER, STRING, BOOLEAN, FLOAT) that are automatically converted to database-specific parameter formats. Returns query results in JSON format with execution metadata.

query_ref.description: The query reference ID that was executed

rows.description: Array of result rows as JSON objects

queue_used.description: Database queue that handled the request

message.example: The Conduit service infrastructure is being built. This endpoint will execute pre-defined queries once the Query Table Cache, parameter processing, and queue selection systems are complete.

query_ref.description: Query identifier from Query Table Cache (required)

get.description: Returns the readiness status of all configured databases for Conduit operations. When authenticated with a valid JWT token, includes additional details like migration status, query cache entries, and DQM statistics.

Initiates the OAuth 2.0 authorization flow. For GET requests, presents a login UI to the user. For POST requests, processes login data and redirects with an authorization code. Supports multiple response types including 'code' for Authorization Code flow and 'token' for Implicit flow.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The OAuth 2.0 client identifier

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: The URI to redirect to after successful authorization

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: The OAuth 2.0 response type

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Space-delimited list of requested scopes

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Opaque value used for state verification

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: String value used for replay prevention

parameters.name: code_challenge
parameters.description: PKCE code challenge

parameters.name: code_challenge_method
parameters.description: PKCE code challenge method

post.description: Initiates the OAuth 2.0 authorization flow. For GET requests, presents a login UI to the user. For POST requests, processes login data and redirects with an authorization code. Supports multiple response types including 'code' for Authorization Code flow and 'token' for Implicit flow.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The OAuth 2.0 client identifier

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: The URI to redirect to after successful authorization

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: The OAuth 2.0 response type

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Space-delimited list of requested scopes

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Opaque value used for state verification

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: String value used for replay prevention

parameters.name: code_challenge
parameters.description: PKCE code challenge

parameters.name: code_challenge_method
parameters.description: PKCE code challenge method

get.description: Returns a JSON document containing the OpenID Provider's configuration information including all supported endpoints, scopes, response types, and claims. This document follows the OpenID Connect Discovery 1.0 specification.

Implements the OpenID Connect RP-Initiated Logout specification. Allows users to log out and terminate their session with the OpenID Provider. Can also notify Relying Parties (client applications) that the user's session has ended.

parameters.name: id_token_hint
parameters.description: The ID Token previously issued to the client

parameters.name: post_logout_redirect_uri
parameters.description: URI to redirect the user to after logout

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Opaque value used by the client to maintain state

post.description: Implements the OpenID Connect RP-Initiated Logout specification. Allows users to log out and terminate their session with the OpenID Provider. Can also notify Relying Parties (client applications) that the user's session has ended.

parameters.name: id_token_hint
parameters.description: The ID Token previously issued to the client

parameters.name: post_logout_redirect_uri
parameters.description: URI to redirect the user to after logout

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Opaque value used by the client to maintain state

post.description: Allows authorized clients to determine the active state of a token and its metadata as specified in RFC 7662. Resource servers use this endpoint to validate tokens presented by clients and retrieve associated metadata.

error_description.example: The request is missing a required parameter

token.description: The string value of the token

token_type_hint.description: A hint about the type of the token

get.description: Returns a set of JSON Web Keys (JWK) that represent the public part of the keys used by the OIDC provider to sign tokens. Clients use these keys to verify the signature of tokens issued by the provider.

post.description: Allows clients to register with the OIDC provider, following the OpenID Connect Dynamic Client Registration protocol. The registration metadata is submitted as a JSON document and the server returns client credentials and configuration.

Allows clients to notify the authorization server that a token is no longer needed, allowing the server to invalidate the token. This endpoint implements RFC 7009 and supports revocation of both access tokens and refresh tokens.

error_description.example: The request is missing a required parameter

token_type_hint.description: A hint about the type of the token

post.description: Issues access tokens, refresh tokens, and ID tokens based on the provided grant type. Supports authorization_code, refresh_token, client_credentials, and password grant types. Client authentication is required either via HTTP Basic Authentication or using client_id and client_secret parameters.

redirect_uri.description: The redirect URI used in the authorization request

client_id.description: The OAuth 2.0 client identifier (if not using HTTP Basic Auth)

client_secret.description: The OAuth 2.0 client secret (if not using HTTP Basic Auth)

username.description: The resource owner username (required for grant_type=password)

password.description: The resource owner password (required for grant_type=password)

code_verifier.description: PKCE code verifier (if code_challenge was used)

get.description: Returns claims about the authenticated end-user. Requires a valid access token with appropriate scopes. The claims returned depend on the scopes associated with the access token and the user's profile data.

error_description.example: The access token does not have the required scopes

post.description: Returns claims about the authenticated end-user. Requires a valid access token with appropriate scopes. The claims returned depend on the scopes associated with the access token and the user's profile data.

error_description.example: The access token does not have the required scopes

get.description: Returns the current application configuration settings in plain text format
Returns the server's configuration file in JSON format, brotli compressed if the client supports it.
Returns a simple health check response indicating the service is alive. Used primarily by load balancers for health monitoring in distributed deployments.
Returns comprehensive system information in JSON format including hardware details, operating system information, runtime statistics, and version information.
Returns system metrics in a format compatible with Prometheus monitoring system
Returns the most recent log messages from the system in reverse chronological order

get.summary:
API diagnostic test endpoint
API diagnostic test endpoint
get.description:
Returns diagnostic information useful for testing and debugging API calls. Supports both GET and POST methods to test different request types. The response includes client IP address, authentication details, headers, query parameters, and POST data.
Returns diagnostic information useful for testing and debugging API calls. Supports both GET and POST methods to test different request types. The response includes client IP address, authentication details, headers, query parameters, and POST data.

post.summary:
API diagnostic test endpoint
API diagnostic test endpoint
post.description:
Returns diagnostic information useful for testing and debugging API calls. Supports both GET and POST methods to test different request types. The response includes client IP address, authentication details, headers, query parameters, and POST data.
Returns diagnostic information useful for testing and debugging API calls. Supports both GET and POST methods to test different request types. The response includes client IP address, authentication details, headers, query parameters, and POST data.
Uploads files via REST API with structured JSON responses. For web-based uploads, use the alternative method described below.

print.description: Set to true to queue file for printing after upload
